verses.roman:
haridāsa kahena,--"yaiche sūryera udaya
udaya nā haite ārambhe tamera haya kṣaya

synonyms: haridāsa kahena—Haridāsa Ṭhākura began to explain; yaiche—like; sūryera udaya—sunrise; udaya nā haite—although not visible; ārambhe—from the beginning; tamera—of darkness; haya kṣaya—there is dissipation.
translation: Haridāsa Ṭhākura said, "As the sun begins to rise, even before visible it dissipates the darkness of night.
